TITLE: Configure BootstrapVueNext in Nuxt 3 DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure the `@bootstrap-vue-next/nuxt` module in a Nuxt 3 application. It imports the module and sets the CSS to include the Bootstrap CSS file. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs.md#_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // nuxt.config.js/ts export default defineNuxtConfig({ modules: ['@bootstrap-vue-next/nuxt'], css: ['bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css'], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Install BootstrapVueNext for Nuxt 3 using NPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Bootstrap, BootstrapVueNext and the Nuxt module for BootstrapVueNext as development dependencies using NPM. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs.md#_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm i bootstrap bootstrap-vue-next @bootstrap-vue-next/nuxt -D ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Vite for Unplugin Icons DESCRIPTION: Configures Vite to use unplugin-icons and unplugin-vue-components. It imports the necessary modules, adds them to the Vite plugins array, and sets options for automatic icon installation and component resolution. This enables the use of icons from various sets without manual imports. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/icons.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // vite.config.js/ts import {defineConfig} from 'vite' import vue from '@vitejs/plugin-vue' import Icons from 'unplugin-icons/vite' import Components from 'unplugin-vue-components/vite' import IconsResolve from 'unplugin-icons/resolver' // https://vitejs.dev/config/ export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ vue(), Components({ resolvers: [IconsResolve()], dts: true, }), Icons({ compiler: 'vue3', autoInstall: true, }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BDropdownItemButton Usage (Vue) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the usage of `BDropdownItemButton` which renders a button element within a dropdown. This is used to create dropdown menu items that trigger actions rather than navigation, making it more semantically correct when no navigation is involved. It's an alternative to using links for actions within a dropdown menu. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/components/dropdown.md#_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Install Bootstrap and BootstrapVueNext using PNPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Bootstrap and BootstrapVueNext packages using the PNPM package manager. It adds the packages as dependencies to your project. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm add bootstrap bootstrap-vue-next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BAlert Model-Value Prop After Migration (Vue) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the updated method to show or hide the `BAlert` component using the `model-value` prop in BootstrapVueNext. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/migration-guide.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Install Unplugin Icons (YARN) DESCRIPTION: Installs unplugin-icons, unplugin-vue-components, and the Vue compiler using YARN as development dependencies. This command is part of the preferred installation method for using icons in a Vue 3 project. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/icons.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn add unplugin-icons unplugin-vue-components @vue/compiler-sfc -D ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Sort Comparer Function DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript function is the default comparer used by BTable when no custom comparer is provided. It retrieves the string value of the items being compared using getStringValue function and performs a locale-aware comparison. The function receives the items to be compared and the key to compare on. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/components/table.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export const defaultSortComparer: BTableSortByComparerFunction = (a, b, key) => { const valA = getStringValue(a, key) ?? '' const valB = getStringValue(b, key) ?? '' return valA.localeCompare(valB, undefined, { numeric: true }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Table Sort By Example (Typescript) DESCRIPTION: This Typescript snippet demonstrates how to pre-specify the column to be sorted and the order of sorting (ascending or descending) using the `sortBy` model in a Bootstrap-Vue-Next table. `sortBy` should be an array containing a single `BTableSortBy` object with a defined `order` field. SOURCE: https://github.com/bootstrap-vue-next/bootstrap-vue-next/blob/main/apps/docs/src/docs/components/table.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export const sortBy = ref([ { key: 'age', order: 'desc', compare: (a: number, b: number) => a - b } ]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Install TypeScript dependencies using NPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs optional peer dependencies required for full TypeScript type support. These dependencies are not installed by default and include `@floating-ui/vue`, `@vueuse/core`, and `vue-router`.
